keyTakeAways: Mohammed Ibrahim, a 16-year-old Palestinian American, is being held in Israeli detention since February 2025, facing harsh conditions including cold cells, insufficient meals, and lack of medical care.
He has lost significant weight and has been denied dinner and fruit, with meals described as extremely minimal and undercooked.
The case has become symbolic of the systemic mistreatment of children in Israeli military prisons, where children are prosecuted in military courts despite international criticism.
Rights groups and US lawmakers, including Congresswoman Ayanna Pressley, are urging the Trump administration to pressure Israel to release him, citing the fact that he is a US citizen.
Israel is the only country in the world that systematically prosecutes children in military courts, raising global human rights concerns.
Mohammed’s family claims Israeli soldiers beat him during arrest and he was transferred from Megiddo prison (described as a 'slaughterhouse') to Ofer detention facility.
Medical reports from Gaza indicate signs of torture and execution among recently released Palestinian detainees, amplifying fears for the safety and health of imprisoned individuals.
The US has provided over $21 billion in aid to Israel over the past two years, giving it diplomatic leverage in such humanitarian cases.
The case has intensified amid broader ceasefire-related prisoner exchanges, prompting renewed calls for the release of detained minors like Mohammed.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Mohammed Ibrahim, a 16-year-old Palestinian American teenager, has been held in Israeli detention since February 2025 following a raid on his family’s home in the West Bank. He has endured harsh conditions including cold cells, minimal and inadequate meals (with no dinner or fruit), and reportedly physical abuse during arrest. Despite being a US citizen, he is being prosecuted in an Israeli military court, where children are systematically tried and treated inhumane conditions. His case has become a symbol of the broader systemic mistreatment of Palestinian minors in Israeli jails, with over 79 detainees reported dead since October 2023 due to lack of medical care and abuse. Rights groups, US lawmakers, and his family are urging the US government, particularly under President Donald Trump, to use diplomatic pressure to secure his release. The situation has gained renewed attention amid the Gaza ceasefire and prisoner exchanges, raising urgent global human rights concerns about children's rights and the treatment of detainees in Israeli military custody.
title: Cold cells, meagre meals: Palestinian American boy suffers in Israeli jail
